member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library
member.summary: Provides a gateway to all features and services in Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework assembly.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.Initialize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the services in this assembly. This should be called on application startup.
member.param: Pass true if this is a UI application that has a message pump (e.g. Winforms, MFC, WPF). Pass false otherwise (e.g. a Console app)

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.SetCulture(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Sets the culture that this assembly will use when returning resources.
member.param: The culture to set

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application name that will be displayed in captions for various dialogs

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.ApplicationVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the application version

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.ExceptionParser
member.summary: Gets a service used to inspect an exception object and return information about it.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.ExceptionParserRegistration
member.summary: Gets a service which associates a custom exception parser with a particular type of exception.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.LoggingProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the interface that the Framework will use for logging.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.MainThreadDispatcher
member.summary: Gets or sets the main application thread. Some properties retrieval (ie. File System Icon) and other operations can only be performed properly on the main application thread.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.MainThreadDispatcherInvokeRequired
member.summary: Gets whether an Invoke is required in order to execute on the thread the MainThreadDispatcher is associated with. Returns true when the current thread is different than the MainThreadDispatcher's thread. Returns false when the MainThreadDispatcher is null or the current thread is the same as the MainThreadDispatcher's thread.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Library.Properties
member.summary: Gets a Properties dictionary that can be used by applications to store global state.

member.summary: The size of a windows shell icon.

member.summary: A Dictionary in which the values can be replaced with a function that computes the value.

The data type of the Values in the dictionary

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.ExceptionRestriction
member.summary: An ExceptionRestriction is extra data that is optionally packaged with an exception.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.FilePathAbsolute
member.summary: A class representing the local path of a file.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.FolderPathAbsolute
member.summary: A class representing the local path of a folder.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.ProgressValue
member.summary: Represents an individual line item of data that can be displayed in a progress dialog. Progress can be reported with Name/Value pairs, or just as an individual value.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.Restriction
member.summary: A restriction is a combination of a restricted object and a reason why an operation failed on the object. An example would be a restriction on deleting a file, becuase a link to the file still exists. All other more specific restrictions types inherit from this base class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.DelegateValueDictionary`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes all keys and values from the Dictionary.

member.returns: true if the dictionary contains an element with the key

member.summary: Determines whether the Dictionary contains an element with the specified key.

member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key whose value to get.
When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider
member.summary: Provides details about a specific type of Exception object.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.ILoggingProvider
member.summary: This interface defines what the VDF expects from a logging system.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IProgressReporter
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for a business logic layer to report results back to the GUI

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.GetErrorCode(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns an error code that identifies the error. Not all exception types support this but it can be of use for certain types if the app wants to have special business logic to handle an error
member.param: The exception object to be parsed.
member.returns: The error code associated with the exception. This may be null or empty if the exception type does not support error codes.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.GetMessage(System.Exception)
member.summary: Retrieves a textual description of the exception
member.param: The exception object to be parsed.
member.returns: The textual description of the exception. This should never be null or empty.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.GetRestrictions(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns a list of restrictions that may be embedded in an exception object.
member.param: The exception object to be parsed.
member.returns: A list of restrictions associated with the exception. This may be null or an empty list if there are no exceptions.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.GetTitle(System.Exception)
member.summary: Retrieves a caption to display in a dialog box for an exception. This can return a generic message like "Error", but it can also return a more detailed message like "File Access Error" where the GetMessage() would return more specific details on the error
member.param: The exception object to be parsed.
member.returns: The caption to display in a dialog box which displays information about the exception. This should never be null or empty.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.IsExpected(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true if the exception is one that could happen naturally and should be handled gracefully...not as a fatal error. For example "File checked out to another user" is an expected exception. "Object reference not found" or "Index out of range" is not
member.param: The exception object to be parsed.

member.name: P:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider.ExceptionType
member.summary: Gets the type of exception that is managed by this provider

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.ILoggingProvider.LogMessage(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Log a message to the logging system.
member.param: The main category.
An optional sub category.
The message to be logged.
System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType
Priority to assign to the message.
UTC start of the of the message. Gives user (optionally) the ability to assign the start time.
Optional list of property name/object pairs to assicated to the log message.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IProgressReporter.ReportProgress(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.ProgressValue},System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports progress to the GUI layer
member.param: The caption of a progress dialog. This should describe the overall operation
The header of the progress report. This should describe the current state of the operation, at a high level
A list of values to display about the current state. This might include file names, file sizes, or other statistics
The % of the overall workflow that has been completed. If not specified, then no cumulative progress indicator will be displayed

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IProgressReporter.ReportProgress(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Currency.ProgressValue},System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports progress to the GUI layer
member.param: The header of the progress report. This should describe the current state of the operation, at a high level
A list of values to display about the current state. This might include file names, file sizes, or other statistics
The % of the overall workflow that has been completed. If not specified, then no cumulative progress indicator will be displayed

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserRegistrationService
member.summary: Associates a custom exception parser with a particular type of exception.

member.name: T:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService
member.summary: This service is used to inspect an exception object and return information about it.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserRegistrationService.GetParser(System.Exception)
member.summary: Retrieves the parser that is used to interrogate an exception object.
member.param: The exception to retrieve a parser for.
member.returns: The provider used to parse . This should never be null because the framework has a built in parser registered with the base class. That parser will be used as a last resort.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserRegistrationService.RegisterParser(Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Interfaces.IExceptionParserProvider)
member.summary: Registers a parser with a particular type of exception object. That parser will be used to inspect all exceptions of the specified type.
member.param: The parser that is used to retrieve information about exceptions for this type.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService.GetErrorCode(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns an error code that identifies the error.
member.param: The exception to parse.
member.returns: The error code associated with the exception. This can be null or empty if the exception type does not support an error code.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService.GetMessage(System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets descriptive text which describes the exception.
member.param: The exception to parse.
member.returns: The text which describes the exception.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService.GetRestrictions(System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets a list of restrictions that may be embedded in an exception object.
member.param: The exception to parse.
member.returns: The list of restrictions embedded in the exception. This can be null or an empty list if there are no restrictions.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService.GetTitle(System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets a caption to display in a dialog box for an exception.
member.param: The exception to parse.
member.returns: The caption to display in a dialog box.

member.name: M:Autodesk.DataManagement.Client.Framework.Services.IExceptionParserService.IsExpected(System.Exception)
member.summary: Determines if an exception is one that could happen naturally and should be handled gracefully or a fatal error.
member.param: The exception to parse.
member.returns: True if the exception is expected. False otherwise.
